title: Jacob Blake
categories: August 2020 events in the United States
Law enforcement controversies in the United States

sentences.text: On August 23, 2020, Jacob Blake, a 29-year-old unarmed black man, was shot seven times by a Kenosha, Wisconsin police officer as he was getting inside of his vehicle.

Protests and rioting occurred in response, as part of the larger Black Lives Matter movement which had seen a resurgence in the wake of high-profile police killings in 2020, including George Floyd and Breonna Taylor.

references.title: Wisconsin Police Shoot Black Man as He’s Getting in Car
Video shows Wisconsin police shooting a Black man multiple times as he enters a car

sentences.text: Witnesses allege that Blake had been attempting to break up a fight between two women.
It is unknown what lead to the police interacting with Blake, but it is reported that they attempted to subdue him with a taser.
Video spread on social media shows Blake surrounded by police with their weapons already drawn.
Blake ignores their demands, walking around his vehicle and attempting to enter it.
As he does, one police officer grabs him and begins firing his weapon into Blake's back.
Blake's attorney later said that Blake's three sons were inside the vehicle at the time.
Blake was left in serious condition and flown to a hospital.

references.title: Wisconsin police shoot Black man as children watch from a car, attorney says
Wisconsin Police Shooting Leaves Black Man In 'Serious Condition'

sentences.text: Wisconsin Governor Tony Evers issued a statement denouncing the excessive use of force by police and invoking the names of African Americans killed by law enforcement.

links.text: excessive use of force by police
links.page: Police brutality in the United States

sentences.text: Evers stated that "While we do not have all of the details yet, what we know for certain is that he is not the first black man or person to have been shot or injured or mercilessly killed at the hands of individuals in law enforcement in our state or our country."
Protests and riots erupted, leading the Kenosha County government to declare a state of emergency overnight on August 24.
Police vehicles were damaged and a dump truck was set on fire.
One officer was hit in the head with a flying object.
Tear gas was deployed by the police.

references.title: Gov. Evers releases statement on shooting of Jacob Blake in Kenosha
